alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 8:01AM CDT until July 16 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Heavy rainfall of 6 to 8 inches has occurred over the Sucarnoochee River basin within the last 2 to 3 hours and a flood warning is now in effect for the Sucarnoochee River. Another statement will be issued by this evening, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River At Livingston. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Flooding of farm lands around Livingston occurs. At 21 feet, Overflow of low-lying agricultural lands increases. Cattle and farm equipment should be moved to higher ground. At 24 feet, Some secondary low-lying roads and a few yards begin to flood in southeast Livingston. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 24 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
